item.title: Hot to add new line to YAML file
item.description: Question How to use command line to add a new line to a yaml file? ChatGPTâ€™s Answer To add a new line to a YAML file from the command line, you can use various tools available in Unix-like systems such as echo, sed, awk, or perl. Here are a few methods to append a new line to a YAML file: 1. Using echo and tee If you want to append a new line to the end of the YAML file, you can use echo combined with tee:
